body:
Addition:

I am observing a similar issue when visiting the ui after running it from the CLI with 
```console
mlflow ui
```
I have an empty list of experiments (which is fine because I did not run any yet). When clicking on the *Models* tab in in the top I get the following error message and the same screen like in the above screenshot:

> INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE: Model registry functionality is unavailable; got unsupported URI './mlruns' for model registry data storage. Supported URI schemes are: ['postgresql', 'mysql', 'sqlite', 'mssql']. See https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#storage for how to run an MLflow server against one of the supported backend storage locations.

I have run the command from an repository where I have installed the pycaret package.

Hi guys!

I could simulate this error locally as well, and it look like the problem I sow is related to the default value of the parameter --backend-store-uri defined in the cli.py (line 231).

The default './mlruns' doesn't match with any available scheme. I have also confirmed (reading comments in the code) that the local file scheme is not available for backend storage. So I believe the default should be SQLite.

I am opening a PR that tries to solves this problem making SQLite the default scheme for the backend store.

This is the Draft PR ->  https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/4425.

may I also add I was confused when I started up mlflow ui .. the help menu gives the impression I can use local backends... or maybe I am just not understanding here..

```
ubuntu@juju-9c16c5-2:~$ mlflow ui --help
Usage: mlflow ui [OPTIONS]

  Launch the MLflow tracking UI for local viewing of run results. To launch
  a production server, use the "mlflow server" command instead.

  The UI will be visible at http://localhost:5000 by default, and only
  accept connections from the local machine. To let the UI server accept
  connections from other machines, you will need to pass ``--host 0.0.0.0``
  to listen on all network interfaces (or a specific interface address).

Options:
  --backend-store-uri PATH     URI to which to persist experiment and run
                               data. Acceptable URIs are SQLAlchemy-compatible
                               database connection strings (e.g.
                               'sqlite:///path/to/file.db') or local
                               filesystem URIs (e.g.
                               'file:///absolute/path/to/directory'). By
                               default, data will be logged to the ./mlruns
                               directory.
  --default-artifact-root URI  Path to local directory to store artifacts, for
                               new experiments. Note that this flag does not
                               impact already-created experiments. Default:
                               ./mlruns
  -p, --port INTEGER           The port to listen on (default: 5000).
  -h, --host HOST              The network address to listen on (default:
                               127.0.0.1). Use 0.0.0.0 to bind to all
                               addresses if you want to access the tracking
                               server from other machines.
  --help                       Show this message and exit.

```

that bit about 

```
or local
                               filesystem URIs (e.g.
                               'file:///absolute/path/to/directory'). By
                               default, data will be logged to the ./mlruns
```

but when I did that... I just get the error again on the models page

```
INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE: Model registry functionality is unavailable; got unsupported URI 'file:///home/ubuntu/Dev/Datalake/output' for model registry data storage. Supported URI schemes are: ['postgresql', 'mysql', 'sqlite', 'mssql'].
 See https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#storage for how to run an MLflow server against one of the supported backend storage locations.
```

if localfiles system is not truly an option here I'd just say it's best to remove that bit from the CLI output.. unless I am wrong in my understanding here

EDIT: ah, as I read further.. perhaps this local file system option is something if you're running off a local experiment with assets in the local file system relative to where I execute `mlflow ui` already existing... but if you have none and no mlruns folder exists.. it just gives this error?? For reference I start `mlflow ui` at the root of my home-dir thinking I could just point it to some folder of my choosing.. but maybe that's not the case.. in this case I will attempt to switch to a PostGres DB
